dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, that earthquake in Kazakhstan, felt all the way in Astana, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, that earthquake in Kazakhstan, felt all the way in Astana, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the earthquake occurred on March 28 at 3:56 PM Astana time, 323 kilometers southwest of Almaty.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, actually. Not really. It was pretty far from Astana, like, way south.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, actually. Not really. It was pretty far from Astana, like, way south.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the earthquake occurred on March 28 at 3:56 PM Astana time, 323 kilometers southwest of Almaty.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? I thought it was, you know, a huge, national thing. Where was it then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? I thought it was, you know, a huge, national thing. Where was it then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so the Ministry of Emergency Situations, they said it was, um, 323 kilometers southwest of Almaty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so the Ministry of Emergency Situations, they said it was, um, three hundred twenty three kilometers southwest of Almaty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the seismic network of the "National Center for Seismological Observations and Research" under the MES, the earthquake occurred on March 28 at 3:56 PM Astana time, 323 kilometers southwest of Almaty.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Southwest of Almaty, okay. So, not close to the capital at all. Was it, like, a big one?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Southwest of Almaty, okay. So, not close to the capital at all. Was it, like, a big one?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, they called it 'energy class 12.3,' and the magnitude was, um, MPV 5.7.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, they called it 'energy class twelve point three,' and the magnitude was, um, M P V five point seven.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "The energy class of the earthquake was 12.3, with a magnitude of MPV 5.7," the statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: MPV 5.7? What's MPV? Is that, like, super strong?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: M P V five point seven? What's M P V? Is that, like, super strong?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's just, you know, a specific measurement scale. But, yeah, 5.7 is, like, pretty significant. Not small at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just, you know, a specific measurement scale. But, yeah, five point seven is, like, pretty significant. Not small at all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, significant. And when did this happen? Just, uh, yesterday morning?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, significant. And when did this happen? Just, uh, yesterday morning?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the earthquake occurred on March 28 at 3:56 PM Astana time

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, yesterday. March 28th, at 3:56 PM, Astana time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, yesterday. March twenty eighth, at three fifty six p m, Astana time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the earthquake occurred on March 28 at 3:56 PM Astana time

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Got it. So, um, who reports on this stuff? Like, how do they know these numbers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Got it. So, um, who reports on this stuff? Like, how do they know these numbers?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That data actually came from the 'National Center for Seismological Observations and Research,' under the MES. They have a whole seismic network.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That data actually came from the 'National Center for Seismological Observations and Research,' under the M E S. They have a whole seismic network.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the seismic network of the "National Center for Seismological Observations and Research" under the MES, the earthquake occurred on March 28 at 3:56 PM Astana time

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, makes sense. And was that the only one, or...?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, makes sense. And was that the only one, or...?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, you know what? Actually, no. It was the second earthquake recorded in southern Kazakhstan within, like, just 24 hours.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, you know what? Actually, no. It was the second earthquake recorded in southern Kazakhstan within, like, just twenty four hours.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is worth noting that this was the second earthquake recorded in southern Kazakhstan within 24 hours.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The second one? Wow. That's, um, that's a lot of seismic activity for one day, isn't it?
